step_1_context.text: If it rains tomorrow, we will cancel the picnic.

step_2_explanation.simple_rule: Use first conditional for real future possibilities.
step_2_explanation.formula: If + present simple, will + base verb
step_2_explanation.common_mistake: Do not use will in the if-clause.

step_3_interactive_exercises.question: Pick the correct first conditional sentence.
options: If she will call, I will answer.
If she calls, I will answer.
If she called, I will answer.
step_3_interactive_exercises.correct_answer: If she calls, I will answer.
step_3_interactive_exercises.explanation_for_failure: Use present simple after if, then will in the main clause.

step_3_interactive_exercises.incorrect_sentence: If it will be sunny, we will go out.
step_3_interactive_exercises.corrected_sentence: If it is sunny, we will go out.
step_3_interactive_exercises.error_analysis: The if-clause uses present simple, not will.
